page.title: 12Smarden Education
page.content: The village is served by a county mixed junior and infant school. The roll averages 90 pupils taught in three classes. The school, founded in 1720, is now housed in a 125 year old building, supplemented by two mobile classrooms. At eleven years of age pupils transfer to a fully comprehensive school nine miles distant in Tenterden. The school day lasts from 9.00 a.m. to 3.30 p.m. with a break for lunch and playtimes. A play group for pre-school children is held in the village hall 3 mornings each week, accommodating 17 children. There is opportunity for adult afternoon or evening classes in the village hall, according to support and demand. Adults seeking vocational classes have to travel to nearby towns, as do teenagers for further education.
